result.execSummary:
The defendant Matheau P. Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matheau P. Martinez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matheau P. Martinez was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Reception at Dodge Correctional.
Credit for 13 days.
Concurrent with: with 14 CF 110

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay all fees and costs.
Follow rules of the Department.
Attend any counseling deemed appropriate.
Obtain a COMPAS assessment and follow recommendations.
Provide a DNA sample unless previously submitted.

BAIL JUMPING, POSS DRUG PARAPHERNALIA; CONDITIONS:   No possession or consumption of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.  No possession or consumption of controlled substances unless prescribed by Physician.
4/28/15- Court orders:  Comply with the Drug Free 24/7 Program. If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.
